notesStmt.note: Excision at outermost end, and a sewn repair suggesting strap attached at some time and pulled away. Damp darkening along edges, plus a few tidemarks. Few usage stains. Trimming has cut into edge. One small edge loss, and excessive trim in places.
A mezuzah, or door-phylactery, attached to the roll at the end (an extra membrane of 70 x 95mm attached at the inner end).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 11 membranes, plus a detached leather strap.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Sir Hans Sloane: baronet, physician and collector (b. 1660, d. 1753): in his collection; acquired by the British Museum in 1753.
